Package Steganography.Logic

Class AESEncryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • Steganography.Logic.AESEncryption

  • public class AESEncryption
extends java.lang.Object
    The AESEncryption class handles the encryption/decryption operation of either a byte array or a file to ensure more security for the steganographic process using password-based AES encryption.

    This class uses these default encryption parameters :

    • Cipher Algorithm : AES (Advanced Encryption Standard)
    • Cipher Algorithm Mode : CBC (Cipher Block Chaining)
    • Cipher Algorithm Padding : PKCS5Padding
    • Cipher Block Size : 128 bit (16 bytes)

      Parameters of the algorithm used to cipher the data.

      private static void setKey​(java.lang.String myKey)
      Hashes the given password using SHA-1 hashing algorithm then uses the first 16 characters of the hashed password to generate the AESEncryption class secret encryption key.

    • Method Detail

      • setKey

        private static void setKey​(java.lang.String myKey)
        Hashes the given password using SHA-1 hashing algorithm then uses the first 16 characters of the hashed password to generate the AESEncryption class secret encryption key.
        Parameters:
        myKey - password given by the user to encrypt the data

      • encrypt

        public static byte[] encrypt​(byte[] input,
                             java.lang.String myKey)
        Encrypts a given byte array using AES encryption.
        Parameters:
        input - byte array to encrypt
        myKey - encryption password
        Returns:
        a byte array with the encrypted data.

      • encrypt

        public static void encrypt​(java.io.File input,
                           java.io.File output,
                           java.lang.String myKey)
        Encrypts a given file into another file using AES encryption.
        Parameters:
        input - file to encrypt
        output - file to which with encrypted data will be written
        myKey - encryption password

        public static byte[] decrypt​(byte[] input,
                             java.lang.String myKey)
        Decrypts a given byte array that was encrypted by encrypt(byte[], String).
        Parameters:
        input - encrypted byte array to be decrypted
        myKey - encryption password
        Returns:
        a byte array with the decrypted data.

      • decrypt

        public static void decrypt​(java.io.File input,
                           java.io.File output,
                           java.lang.String myKey)
        Decrypts a given file that was encrypted by encrypt(File, File, String).
        Parameters:
        input - encrypted file to be decrypted
        output - file to which decrypted data will be written to
        myKey - encryption password

      • process

        private static void process​(javax.crypto.Cipher ci,
                            java.io.File input,
                            java.io.File output)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Ciphers a file into another file in chunks using a buffer for reading the file.
        Parameters:
        ci - cryptographic cipher for encryption or decryption
        input - file before cryptographic operation
        output - file after cryptographic operation
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when reading or writing the file streams.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if an error is related to the cipher operation (ex : wrong encryption password).
